rComments: This class was a really easy A. I didn't do a lot of the readings but was able to complete the essays based off of discussions in class. He could get kinda confusing sometimes, but he's super nice and willing to answer any questions.

Dr. D is a really cool guy, but like many other people have said, he may be a little too old for teaching. Nothing against him, but the class is just so hard to sit through when he has no idea what anyone is saying. Will remind you of your favorite gramps, so its a mildly happy class. Just boring. I never read but I survived. just participate

Core course was mostly a discussion based class and an easy A. Schultz is kind of out of it, he's super old but really nice and funny.  We had one test which was self graded. Our class wrote 1 or 2 papers LESS that other core courses. He's really lax. Mandatory attendance but you could probably sneak out without him noticing. Haha
Super nice, and always willing to go the extra mile to help you get a better grade. Dope guy.

He is clearly an intelligent teacher that is willing to push students to challenge themselves. Even so, I didn't think he was a very good moderator in discussions mainly because the class went off topic often. He's a pretty good teacher.

Boring. Converse even if you have no clue what you're talking about. He offers no real help in revising your papers. He doesn't understand some concepts and asks you to clarify statements that are already clear. You don't need to read the core reader to commit to the conversations. Skim over the text for quotes in your essays. Talking = A

If you like to sit in a room in silence for spans of 1-2 minutes at a time, this is the class for you.  Overwhelming amount of awkward silences.  He will literally ask a question and not speak until someone answers it.  Hard class, you have to put effort into it.  Not an "easy A".

Kinda seems a little too old to be teaching. He had a hard time understanding the students in discussion. He is very approachable, you just have to be prepared to speak slowly and clearly and avoid any kind of slang.

"Dr.D" was a highly intelligent and well-versed professor. His class about justice taught me more than I could have imagined and was very interesting at the same time. If you participate in class and show improvement in your writing, you will get an A in the class. He is a very fair grader and is also very helpful outside of class.Highly recommend!

This class was hard to show up to. It was often filled with redundant conversations,  strange insights and, most of all, AWKWARD SILENCES. Feedback on papers was not helpful, if you even got feedback. And, even thought I participated frequently and had good marks on my essays, I was given a B+, not the A that I overwhelmingly deserved.

I found that many of the themes and material discussed in the Literature and Medicine course helpful in terms of my other classes. I feel that Professor Schultz was very good at leading productive discussions, and I found his input on my work very helpful.
Great teaching ability. I enjoyed the class yet was challenged to improve my writing skills and develop them on a more mature level. Highly recommended.

Professor Schultz was a passionate and engaged lecturer. He brought and even handed approach to moderating fruitful class discussions and his availability outside the classroom was second to none. While other students have complained about grading style, I found my grades to be an accurate reflection of effort and quality. Overall, great Professor!

I really enejoyed this section for the Cowell core class. I thought that often Dawson stimulated really strong and thoughtful discussions. But there were definitely times that there was complete and awkward silence. Definitely one of the easiest sections, paper topics were sometime unclear.

This class is fairly easy as far as difficulty goes. You simply show up, engage in discussion having read the material beforehand. Professor is often vague. Though, nothing a question or two can clear up. Essays are the most important part of the class. The professor grades on whether or not the student has improved from one essay to the next.

Dr. D's class is hard work, but he's always been helpful, and willing to dedicate time to students to help them w/ papers and the class.  I appreciate how much time he took to help me out w/ my writing, most professors don't do that to that extent.  Class discussions were great, material was well chosen and thought-provoking.

While professor Schultz is kind and most definitely knows his stuff, much of each class consisted of his monologues. Feedback on written work was often cryptic or vague, and his expectancies for an A are high.

Professor Schultz is a nice person, but his teaching style is awful.  Most days, he comes in and babbles on about philosophical ideas relating to the material.  He is hard to please and only gave me a B+, despite my high level of participation.  In my eval said I was a great student, yet put writing suggestions in my permanent record.  What nerve!!

At first I didn't like the class, but after I got used to his teaching style I ended up enjoying it. Dawson, although vague sometimes, is very intelligent and can start interesting conversations, etc. Not too much homework.
